blocks.name: df-cncf
blocks.content: Define the operation whose value is a class of continuous complex functions. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 11-Oct-2007.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-cncf(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {
  |- wceq(ccncf, cmpo(s0, s1, cpw(cc), cpw(cc), crab(s2, co(cv(s1), cmap, cv(s0)), wral(s3, cv(s0), wral(s4, crp, wrex(s5, crp, wral(s6, cv(s0), wi(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cv(s3), cmin, cv(s6))), clt, cv(s5)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cmin, cfv(cv(s2), cv(s6)))), clt, cv(s4))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)

  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s6)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)

  -| diffss(s1, s6)

  -| diffss(s4, s6)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s6)
  -| diffss(s3, s6)
}

blocks.origin:
thm dfii3(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cii, co(c0, crest, co(nat0, cicc, nat1)))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
} = {
  eqcomi(cii, co(c0, crest, co(nat0, cicc, nat1)))
  mp2an(wceq(co(c0, crest, co(nat0, cicc, nat1)), cii), wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc)), wss(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cc))
  cnxmet()
  sstri(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cc, cr)
  unitssre()
  ax-resscn()
  metrest(ccom(cabs, cmin), cc, co(nat0, cicc, nat1), c0, cii, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), co(nat0, cicc, nat1))))
  eqid(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), co(nat0, cicc, nat1))))
  cnfldtopn(c0)
  df-ii()
}

  eqid(((abs âˆ˜ -)|`((0[[,]]1)Ã—(0[[,]]1))))
  cnfldtopn(c0)
  df-ii()
}

blocks.name: cncfss
blocks.content: The set of continuous functions is expanded when the range is expanded. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Aug-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm cncfss(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c1, cc)), wss(co(c2, ccncf, c0), co(c2, ccncf, c1)))
} = {
  ssrdv(hs0, co(c2, ccncf, c0), co(c2, ccncf, c1), wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c1, cc)))
  ex(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c1, cc)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, ccncf, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, ccncf, c1)))
  mpbird(wa(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c1, cc)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, ccncf, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, ccncf, c1)), wf(cv(hs0), c2, c1))
  fssd(cv(hs0), c2, c1, c0, wa(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c1, cc)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, ccncf, c0))))
  adantl(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c1, cc)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, ccncf, c0)), wf(cv(hs0), c2, c0))
  cncff(cv(hs0), c2, c0)
  simpll(wss(c0, c1), wss(c1, cc), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, ccncf, c0)))
  adantll(wss(c0, c1), wss(c1, cc), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, ccncf, c0)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c2, ccncf, c1)), wf(cv(hs0), c2, c1)))
  cncffvrn(c1, cv(hs0), c2, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c2, ccncf, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(co(c2, ccncf, c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wss(c0, c1), wss(c1, cc)))
}

thm climcncf(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(ccom(c0, c1), cli, cfv(c0, c2)))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c5, ccncf, c6)))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c5))
} = {
  climcn1(hs2, hs0, hs1, hs3, ccom(c0, c1), c0, c2, c3, c4, c5, c1, universe, w0)
  syldan(w0, wcel(cv(hs2), c5), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(hs2)), cc), wcel(cfv(c0, cv(hs2)), c6))
  ffvelrnda(cv(hs2), c5, c0, c6, w0)

blocks.name: divccncf
blocks.content: Division by a constant is continuous. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 28-Nov-2007.)

thm divccncf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, co(cc, ccncf, cc)))

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrd(c1, co(cc, ccncf, cc), cmpt(s0, cc, co(co(nat1, cdiv, c0), cmul, cv(s0))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  syl5eq(c1, cmpt(s0, cc, co(co(nat1, cdiv, c0), cmul, cv(s0))), cmpt(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), cdiv, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  mpteq2dva(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), cdiv, c0), co(co(nat1, cdiv, c0), cmul, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  ancoms(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(cv(s0), cc), wceq(co(cv(s0), cdiv, c0), co(co(nat1, cdiv, c0), cmul, cv(s0))))

blocks.content: The composition of two continuous maps on complex numbers is also continuous. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2014.)

blocks.name: cncfcn
blocks.content: Relate complex function continuity to topological continuity. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cncfcn(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, cc), wss(c1, cc)), wceq(co(c0, ccncf, c1), co(c2, ccn, c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c4, crest, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c4, crest, c1))
} = {
  eqtr4d(co(c0, ccncf, c1), co(c2, ccn, c3), co(cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0))), ccn, cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1)))), wa(wss(c0, cc), wss(c1, cc)))
  cncfmet(c0, c1, cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0))), cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1))), cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0)), cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1)))
  oveq12d(c2, ccn, c3, cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0))), cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1))), wa(wss(c0, cc), wss(c1, cc)))
  syl5eq(c2, cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0))), co(c4, crest, c0), wa(wss(c0, cc), wss(c1, cc)))
  sylancr(wa(wss(c0, cc), wss(c1, cc)), wceq(co(c4, crest, c0), cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0)))), wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc)), wss(c0, cc))
  simpl(wss(c0, cc), wss(c1, cc))
  metrest(ccom(cabs, cmin), cc, c0, c4, cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0))), cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0)))
  eqid(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0)))
  eqid(cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0))))
  syl5eq(c3, cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1))), co(c4, crest, c1), wa(wss(c0, cc), wss(c1, cc)))
  sylancr(wa(wss(c0, cc), wss(c1, cc)), wceq(co(c4, crest, c1), cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1)))), wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc)), wss(c1, cc))
  cnxmet()
  simpr(wss(c0, cc), wss(c1, cc))
  metrest(ccom(cabs, cmin), cc, c1, c4, cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1))), cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1)))
  eqid(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1)))
  cnfldtopn(c4)
  eqid(cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c1, c1))))
}

  sylancr((c0 âŠ† â„‚ âˆ§ c1 âŠ† â„‚), (c4[|`t]c1)=(MetOpen `((abs âˆ˜ -)|`(c1 Ã— c1))), (abs âˆ˜ -)âˆˆ(*Met ` â„‚), c1 âŠ† â„‚)
  cnxmet()

  metrest((abs âˆ˜ -), cc, c1, c4, (MetOpen `((abs âˆ˜ -)|`(c1 Ã— c1))), ((abs âˆ˜ -)|`(c1 Ã— c1)))

blocks.name: cncfcn1

blocks.name: cncfmptc
blocks.content: A constant function is a continuous function on ` CC ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cncfmptc(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cc), wss(c1, cc)), wcel(cmpt(s0, c2, c0), co(c2, ccncf, c1)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  eleqtrrd(cmpt(s0, c2, c0), co(c2, ccncf, c1), co(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c2), ccn, co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cc), wss(c1, cc)))
  cnmptc(s0, c2, c0, co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c2), co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c1), c1, w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cc), wss(c1, cc)))
  sylancr(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cc), wss(c1, cc)), wcel(co(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), crest, c2), cfv(ctopon, c2)), wcel(cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), cfv(ctopon, cc)), wss(c2, cc))

  cnfldtopon(c4)
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, ccmp), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, c3))), wb(wcel(c1, co(c0, chmeo, co(c4, crest, c3))), wf1o(c1, cuni(c0), cuni(co(c4, crest, c3)))), wcel(c0, ccmp), wcel(co(c4, crest, c3), cha), wcel(c1, co(c0, ccn, co(c4, crest, c3))))
  simpl(wcel(c0, ccmp), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, c3)))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, ccmp), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, c3))), wcel(co(c4, crest, c3), cha), wcel(c4, cha), wcel(c3, universe))
  cnfldhaus(c4)
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, ccmp), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, c3))), wcel(c3, universe), wss(c3, cc))
  ssex(c3, cc)
  cnex()
  resthaus(c4, c3, universe)
  eleqtrd(c1, co(c0, ccn, co(c4, crest, c3)), co(c2, ccncf, c3), wa(wcel(c0, ccmp), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, c3))))
  simpr(wcel(c0, ccmp), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, c3)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, ccmp), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccncf, c3))), wceq(co(c2, ccncf, c3), co(c0, ccn, co(c4, crest, c3))), wss(c2, cc), wss(c3, cc))

  restuni(c4, c2, cc)

  sylancr((c0 âˆˆ Comp âˆ§ c1 âˆˆ(c2[-cn->]c3)), c3 = â‹ƒ(c4[|`t]c3), c4 âˆˆ Top, c3 âŠ† â„‚)

  syl3anc((c0 âˆˆ Comp âˆ§ c1 âˆˆ(c2[-cn->]c3)), (c1 âˆˆ(c0[Homeo](c4[|`t]c3))â†”(c1 : â‹ƒ c0 â†” â‹ƒ(c4[|`t]c3))), c0 âˆˆ Comp, (c4[|`t]c3)âˆˆ Haus, c1 âˆˆ(c0[Cn](c4[|`t]c3)))
  simpl(c0 âˆˆ Comp, c1 âˆˆ(c2[-cn->]c3))

blocks.name: expcncf

blocks.name: cnmptre

blocks.origin:
thm cnmptre(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c2, ccn, c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| wceq(c2, co(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), crest, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, co(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), crest, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c5, cr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, cc, c1), co(c4, ccn, c4)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  eleqtrd(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c2, ccn, c3), co(c2, ccn, co(c4, crest, c5)), w0)
  mpbid(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c2, ccn, co(c4, crest, c5))), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c2, ccn, c4)))
  eleqtrd(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c2, ccn, c4), co(co(c4, crest, c0), ccn, c4), w0)
  cnmpt1res(s0, c0, c1, co(c4, crest, c0), c4, c4, cc, w0)
  eqid(co(c4, crest, c0))
  a1i(w0, wcel(c4, cfv(ctopon, cc)))
  syl6ss(c0, cc, cr, w0)
  oveq1d(co(c4, crest, c0), ccn, c4, c2, w0)
  syl6eqr(co(c4, crest, c0), c2, co(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), crest, c0), w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(co(c4, crest, c0), co(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), crest, c0)), wss(c0, cr))
  rerest(c0, c4, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  mp3an2i(w0, wb(wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c2, ccn, c4)), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), co(c2, ccn, co(c4, crest, c5)))), wcel(c4, cfv(ctopon, cc)), wss(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), c5), wss(c5, cc))
  cnfldtopon(c4)
  frnd(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c5, c0, w0)
  fmpttd(s0, c0, c1, c5, w0)
  syl6ss(c5, cc, cr, w0)
  ax-resscn()
  cnrest2(c4, cc, cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c5, c2)
  oveq2d(c2, ccn, co(c4, crest, c5), c3, w0)
  syl6eqr(co(c4, crest, c5), c3, co(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), crest, c5), w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(co(c4, crest, c5), co(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), crest, c5)), wss(c5, cr))
  rerest(c5, c4, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  eqid(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  diff.cc.s(s0)
}

thm icoopnst(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

blocks.name: iocopnst
blocks.content: A half-open interval ending at ` B ` is open in the closed interval from ` A ` to ` B ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Dec-2013.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: icchmeo
blocks.content: The natural bijection from ` [ 0 , 1 ] ` to an arbitrary nontrivial closed interval ` [ A , B ] ` is a homeomorphism. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: icopnfhmeo
blocks.content: The defined bijection from ` [ 0 , 1 ) ` to ` [ 0 , +oo ) ` is an order isomorphism and a homeomorphism. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: iccpnfhmeo
blocks.content: The defined bijection from ` [ 0 , 1 ] ` to ` [ 0 , +oo ] ` is an order isomorphism and a homeomorphism. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: xrhmeo

blocks.name: xrhmph
blocks.content: The extended reals are homeomorphic to the interval ` [ 0 , 1 ] ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  mp2an(wbr(cneg(nat1), clt, nat1), wbr(cneg(nat1), clt, nat0), wbr(nat0, clt, nat1))
  neg1lt0()

blocks.name: xrcmp
blocks.content: The topology of the extended reals is compact. Since the topology of the extended reals extends the topology of the reals (by ~ xrtgioo ), this means that ` RR* ` is a compactification of ` RR ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: xrconn
blocks.content: The topology of the extended reals is connected. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: icccvx
blocks.content: A linear combination of two reals lies in the interval between them. Equivalently, a closed interval is a convex set. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm icccvx(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wi(w3a(wcel(c2, co(c0, cicc, c1)), wcel(c3, co(c0, cicc, c1)), wcel(c4, co(nat0, cicc, nat1))), wcel(co(co(co(nat1, cmin, c4), cmul, c2), caddc, co(c4, cmul, c3)), co(c0, cicc, c1))))
} = {

blocks.name: oprpiece1res1
blocks.content: Restriction to the first part of a piecewise defined function. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 11-Jun-2010.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm oprpiece1res1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wceq(cres(c0, cxp(co(c1, cicc, c2), c3)), c4)
  -| wcel(c1, cr)
  -| wcel(c5, cr)
  -| wbr(c1, cle, c5)
  -| wcel(c6, universe)
  -| wcel(c7, universe)
  -| wcel(c2, co(c1, cicc, c5))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpo(s0, s1, co(c1, cicc, c5), c3, cif(c6, c7, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2))))
  -| wceq(c4, cmpo(s0, s1, co(c1, cicc, c2), c3, c6))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
} = {
  a1ii(wceq(cres(c0, cxp(co(c1, cicc, c2), c3)), c4), wcel(c6, universe))
  a1ii(wceq(cres(c0, cxp(co(c1, cicc, c2), c3)), c4), wcel(c7, universe))
  3eqtr4i(cres(c0, cxp(co(c1, cicc, c2), c3)), c4, cres(cmpo(s0, s1, co(c1, cicc, c5), c3, cif(c6, c7, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2))), cxp(co(c1, cicc, c2), c3)), cmpo(s0, s1, co(c1, cicc, c2), c3, cif(c6, c7, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2))))
  mp2an(wceq(cres(cmpo(s0, s1, co(c1, cicc, c5), c3, cif(c6, c7, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2))), cxp(co(c1, cicc, c2), c3)), cmpo(s0, s1, co(c1, cicc, c2), c3, cif(c6, c7, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), wss(co(c1, cicc, c2), co(c1, cicc, c5)), wss(c3, c3))
  mp2an(wss(co(c1, cicc, c2), co(c1, cicc, c5)), wcel(c1, co(c1, cicc, c5)), wcel(c2, co(c1, cicc, c5)))
  mp3an(wcel(c1, co(c1, cicc, c5)), wcel(c1, cxr), wcel(c5, cxr), wbr(c1, cle, c5))
  rexri(c5)
  lbicc2(c1, c5)
  iccss2(c1, c1, c5, c2)

blocks.name: cnrehmeo
blocks.content: The canonical bijection from ` ( RR X. RR ) ` to ` CC ` described in ~ cnref1o is in fact a homeomorphism of the usual topologies on these sets. (It is also an isometry, if ` ( RR X. RR ) ` is metrized with the l<SUP>2</SUP> norm.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnrehmeo(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wcel(c0, co(co(c1, ctx, c1), chmeo, c2))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpo(s0, s1, cr, cr, co(cv(s0), caddc, co(ci, cmul, cv(s1)))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  mptru(wcel(c0, co(co(c1, ctx, c1), chmeo, c2)))
  sylanbrc(wtru, wcel(c0, co(co(c1, ctx, c1), chmeo, c2)), wcel(c0, co(co(c1, ctx, c1), ccn, c2)), wcel(ccnv(c0), co(c2, ccn, co(c1, ctx, c1))))
  syl5eqel(c0, co(co(c1, ctx, c1), ccn, c2), cmpo(s0, s1, cr, cr, co(cv(s0), caddc, co(ci, cmul, cv(s1)))), wtru)

  cnmpt2nd(s0, s1, cr, cr, c1, c1, wtru)

blocks.name: cnheibor
blocks.content: Heine-Borel theorem for complex numbers. A subset of ` CC ` is compact iff it is closed and bounded. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: rellycmp
blocks.content: The topology on the reals is locally compact. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: bndth
blocks.content: The Boundedness Theorem. A continuous function from a compact topological space to the reals is bounded (above). (Boundedness below is obtained by applying this theorem to ` -u F ` .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm bndth(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cfv(c1, cv(s1)), cle, cv(s0)))))
  -| wceq(c0, cuni(c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, ccmp))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, co(c2, ccn, c3)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cfv(c1, cv(s1)), cle, cv(s0))))), diffsc(s0, c0))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cfv(c1, cv(s1)), cle, cv(s0))))), diffsc(s0, c2))

blocks.name: evth
blocks.content: The Extreme Value Theorem. A continuous function from a nonempty compact topological space to the reals attains its maximum at some point in the domain. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: evth2
blocks.content: The Extreme Value Theorem, minimum version. A continuous function from a nonempty compact topological space to the reals attains its minimum at some point in the domain. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: lebnumlem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ lebnum . The function ` F ` measures the sum of all of the distances to escape the sets of the cover. Since by assumption it is a cover, there is at least one set which covers a given point, and since it is open, the point is a positive distance from the edge of the set. Thus, the sum is a strictly positive number. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Feb-2015.) (Revised by AV, 30-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: lebnumlem3
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ lebnum . By the previous lemmas, ` F ` is continuous and positive on a compact set, so it has a positive minimum ` r ` . Then setting ` d = r / # ( U ) ` , since for each ` u e. U ` we have ` ball ( x , d ) C_ u ` iff ` d <_ d ( x , X \ u ) ` , if ` -. ball ( x , d ) C_ u ` for all ` u ` then summing over ` u ` yields ` sum_ u e. U d ( x , X \ u ) = F ( x ) < sum_ u e. U d = r ` , in contradiction to the assumption that ` r ` is the minimum of ` F ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-Sep-2015.) (Revised by AV, 30-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: lebnum
blocks.content: The Lebesgue number lemma, or Lebesgue covering lemma. If ` X ` is a compact metric space and ` U ` is an open cover of ` X ` , then there exists a positive real number ` d ` such that every ball of size ` d ` (and every subset of a ball of size ` d ` , including every subset of diameter less than ` d ` ) is a subset of some member of the cover. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Feb-2015.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 5-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: xlebnum
blocks.content: Generalize ~ lebnum to extended metrics. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: lebnumii
blocks.content: Specialize the Lebesgue number lemma ~ lebnum to the closed unit interval. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lebnumii(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, cii), wceq(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cuni(c0))), wrex(s0, cn, wral(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c0, wss(co(co(co(cv(s1), cmin, nat1), cdiv, cv(s0)), cicc, co(cv(s1), cdiv, cv(s0))), cv(s2))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
} = {
  mpd(wa(wss(c0, cii), wceq(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cuni(c0))), wrex(s0, cn, wral(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c0, wss(co(co(co(cv(s1), cmin, nat1), cdiv, cv(s0)), cicc, co(cv(s1), cdiv, cv(s0))), cv(s2))))), wrex(hs1, crp, wral(hs0, co(nat0, cicc, nat1), wrex(s2, c0, wss(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cbl, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), co(nat0, cicc, nat1)))), cv(hs1)), cv(s2))))))
  lebnum(hs1, hs0, s2, co(nat0, cicc, nat1), c0, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), co(nat0, cicc, nat1))), cii, wa(wss(c0, cii), wceq(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cuni(c0))))
  df-ii()
  a1i(wa(wss(c0, cii), wceq(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cuni(c0))), wcel(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), co(nat0, cicc, nat1))), cfv(cmet, co(nat0, cicc, nat1))))
  mp2an(wcel(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), co(nat0, cicc, nat1))), cfv(cmet, co(nat0, cicc, nat1))), wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cmet, cc)), wss(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cc))
  cnmet()

  iicmp()
  simpl(wss(c0, cii), wceq(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cuni(c0)))
  simpr(wss(c0, cii), wceq(co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cuni(c0)))
